fields.description:
At this time, any user with *Browse Project* permissions is able to integrate JIRA with Slack. This can cause problems where non-JIRA users are part of the Slack channel and should not see updates from JIRA.

As a JIRA admin there's no easy way to disable all users from being able to integrate JIRA with Slack. A permission scheme for Slack integration is currently being requested where JIRA admins  can determine which users can integrate JIRA with Slack and which users can't. The ability to disable JIRA integration entirely is also functionality that is desired.
fields.summary: As a JIRA admin I'd like to be able to set permissions for adding Slack integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing CSV file, system will fail to import with the following error:
 "Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state: com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException: Attempted to perform non-db capable search in Vertigo mode: Attempted to perform non-db capable search in Vertigo mode"

 - !Screenshot from 2017-06-12 18-44-36.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Navigate to *External System Import*
 # Select *CSV*
 # Select CSV file to upload > complete 3 steps
 # Select *Begin Import*

h3. Expected Result

Issues/projects to be created. Sample:
 - !Screenshot from 2017-06-12 19-23-49.png|thumbnail!

h3. Current Result

Import failed - 
  - !Screenshot from 2017-06-12 18-44-36.png|thumbnail!
 - !Screenshot from 2017-06-12 18-45-02.png|thumbnail!

Cloud version: JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT
fields.summary: CSV import failing on some instances

fields.description: Revert to a single screen entry for username and password as its frustrating to use the new UI. Also, remember that you have asked if I want to display name or username instead of asking every time I login.
fields.summary: Login

fields.description: Add the text filter from the backlog view to board view
fields.summary: Add the text filter from the backlog view to board view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *Atlassian Update from July 13th, 2017:* This is a bug in Tempo Timesheets add-on implementation, not JIRA itself. Tempo was notified about this issue, but at the moment of writing this update there was no confirmed plan to get it fixed. Please report an issue to Tempo Support team.
{panel}

h2. Summary
Setting Time Tracking provider in https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin.jspa to *JIRA provided time tracking* will be rolled back to Tempo Timesheets after Tempo upgrade.

h2. Environment
JIRA Cloud JIRA v1000.1043.2

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Set the Time Tracking provider to JIRA provided time tracking
# Subscribe to Tempo Timesheets add-on

h2. Actual behavior
Time Tracking provider will be automatically set to Tempo Timesheets after Tempo upgrade and a reindex alert will appear in the instance:
 !2017-06-09 16_25_46-Clipboard.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Expected behavior
Time Tracking provider remains as JIRA provided time tracking
fields.summary: Time Tracking provider is automatically set to Tempo Timesheets after Tempo upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a JQL query, when using CHANGED or WAS in conjunction with *Status*, it throws this error:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
OR
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the *Issue Navigator*, choosing *Advanced* mode.
# Create a new query using {{STATUS CHANGED FROM}}.

h3. Expected Results
You will be able to search for issues.

h3. Actual Results
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
OR
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

fields.description: It would be so convenient if Jira would export content of descriptions and comments in the same markup format that Confluence would understand. That's not the case, however, so I end up translating things, for example, I need to translate monospace into \<code\>monospace\<\/code\>
fields.summary: Jira and confluence Markup

fields.description:
Currently, it is necessary to disconnect G Suite and verify our domains to be able to edit users' email addresses who are not synced by G Suite.

As an administrator, I would like to be able to edit the email addresses from users who do not belong to G Suite groups without being necessary to disable G Suite and verify domains.
fields.summary: Ability to edit email  from users out of G Suite groups

fields.description:
we want to be able to customize boards for business teams much the way we do it for software teams.  Not having a "configure" button and being able to set quick-filters, etc, is a total killer and is making us roll all of the business projects over to JIRA software.

*Reporter*: Bastian Schoell
*E-mail*: [mailto:bastian@levelsleep.com]
fields.summary: Bring all the customization of JIRA software to JIRA Core boards

fields.description:
Sub-Tasks do not show their priority when listed in the issue details view in the backlog. This requires the user to "go into" each issue that they wish to determine the priority of.
It would help improve efficiency and usability to show this information on the issue detail view.
fields.summary: Show sub-task priority in backlog issue detail view, like for linked issues.

fields.description:
{panel:title=2017-08-31 - Message from JIRA Cloud team}

Thank you to everyone for your patience whilst we work on this issue. We can now confirm that this problem should be resolved for JIRA Cloud customers.

If you *continue* to experience this issue, or you are a customer experiencing this issue *for the first time*, please do get in touch with our Support team (getsupport.atlassian.com) to get the best assistance in remedying the problem.

Thanks,
JIRA Cloud team
{panel}


h3. Summary

When adding a value in the Due Date field, the user filled in the time expected in the timezone set in their profile. However, this date is converted to UTC and is perceived as the wrong date for the users of Jira.

This occurs for Due dates on issues, Start & Release dates on versions, and Date-only custom fields on issues (not Date&Time custom fields).

h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround
fields.summary: Due date, Version dates or Date custom fields are showing up in a different timezone than the timezone in general configuration and user's profile

fields.description:
Users and Roles page was always loaded to jira-admin regardless of project role, so admin can add themselves if needed. 
New People page is not loading and there are errors in the Console (more errors for JSD project)
   !People_-_JIRA.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: People page is not loading for jira-admin if it is not in any Project role
test123

fields.description:
Currently every language has to use English keyboard shortcuts. For example, c to create issue, g+d to Go to Dashboard, etc.

It might be a good idea to have keyboard shortcuts specific to the language.
fields.summary: Language specific keyboard shortcuts

fields.description:
From an Admin screen, the + button in the sidebar doesn't create issues.

Workaround:
 * Create issues from non-admin screens
 * Opt-out ADG3
fields.summary: Create Issue doesn't work from the Admin screens

fields.description:
When we access intance-id.atlassian.com/admin/accessconfig we have the checkbox *Can sign in*. It's not so clear about the functionality due to this description. 

Although If we click on (?) icon it shows the explanation:
{quote}All users in 'Can sign in' groups will count towards your product license, and when a user is granted access to a product, they will be added to the products default group.
{quote}

It would be great if there was some description such as "Count towards license" or some similar approach.
fields.summary: The term "Can Sign" in is not clear in application access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When an issue is moved across swim lanes, JIRA automatically scrolls to the position of that new task. When I am trying to move multiple tasks, this becomes frustrating.

# Have more than one swim lane
# Have many items listed in one swim lane so that you are able to scroll the window
# Have at least one item in the other swim lane
# Move the one item to the long swim lane

Desired behavior:
JIRA scroll position remains, does not move

Actual behavior:
JIRA auto scrolls to the bottom of second swim lane, showing the user where the card ended up.

h3. Why this is important
 
This would be very useful for customers that have a lot of issues and use boards on daily basis to organize them,
fields.summary: Ability to toggle autoscrolling off in boards

fields.description:
- Summary
When trying to use Heading formatting (h1., h2., etc) using the Wiki Style Renderer between two closed braces with any character it doesn't work.

 - Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.1034.2
 

 - Steps to Reproduce

 # enable the Wiki Style Renderer on a field (e.g. Description)
 # Add a value to the field using the heading formatting  (h1., h2., etc.)
 # Add a character between two braces before the value (e.g. \{j})
 # Add a character between two braces after the value
 # e.g: \{j} h1. test: \{j}

 - Expected Results
The text formatting should be rendered.

 - Actual Results
The text formatting is not rendered:
fields.summary: Heading formatting not working between Brace characters

fields.description:
We received several suggestions from users that would like to have an *Asset Management* project template in JIRA, as suggested in some blog posts, documents and videos from Atlassian.

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Asset Management project type

fields.description:
h2. Current Behavior
Currently for Issues CSV Import, for assignee and reporters, it will always be created as *ACTIVE* users in JIRA where the users will be assigned application access and will receive the e-mail invitation. This creates a problem in a scenario where the users are not longer working in the company / the users are not longer active.

h2. Proposed Solution
To have an option to set the users as active / inactive for assignee and reporters when doing the CSV import. The admin can choose whether to set the created users as active / inactive
fields.summary: CSV Import should be able to specify whether the assignee and reporters are created as ACTIVE or INACTIVE users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When sending an email to the default JIRA inbox, jira@_instancename_.atlassian.net, the emails are being bounced back with a failed delivery message. 

h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Send an email to jira@_instancename_.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results

Email is received by JIRA, and issue or comment is created.

h3. Actual Results

No ticket/comment is created and an email is received with the following failed delivery message.

'This message could not be delivered.
Action: failed
Final-Recipient: rfc822; jira@_instancename_.atlassian.net
Original-Recipient: rfc822; jira@_instancename_.atlassian.net
Diagnostic-Code: smtp; 550 5.1.1 Mailbox does not exist
Status: 5.1.1'

h3.Workaround

Atlassian support has a manual workaround to re-enable the mailbox. Please raise a ticket with support to have this resolved.
fields.summary: Emails sent to default JIRA inbox are bounced back

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Progress bar goes beyond 100% while cloning issues with sub-tasks or links

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with sub-tasks
 !Issue with Sub-tasks.png|thumbnail! 
# Open the issue, go to *'...'* at the top right and choose 'Clone'
# Select 'Clone sub-taks', and click on 'Create'
 !Clone with Sub-tasks.png|thumbnail! 
# Try the same for issues with links to other issues.
 
h3. Expected Results
Progress bar should ideally show upto 100% while cloning.

h3. Actual Results
Progress bar goes beyond 100% based on the number of sub-taks or linked issues.
 !Progress Bar.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Progress bar goes beyond 100% while cloning issues with sub-tasks or links

fields.description:
95% of the time, if I'm assigning a ticket to somebody, I am also changing the ticket's status (most commonly from In Progress to For Review). Right now, this requires two operations – not a big deal, but it does generate two emails for everybody watching the ticket.

I would _love_ it if I could change a ticket's status on the Assign screen (when you hit 'a' on the keyboard).

Thanks for considering my request!
fields.summary: Ability to assign and change workflow in one step

fields.description:
Currently, the mail handler feature allows the association with a single project when choosing the *Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* in the *incoming mail* screen. 
Ideally, other handlers should also have this behavior and allow the association with a single project, but this functionality isn't provided. 

h6. Current behavior
* Access the incoming mail page
* Click on *add incoming mail handler*
* Choose any handler except the *Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue*
* The next screen won't allow the selection of a single project

h6. Proposed behavior
Allow the selection of a single project apart of the selected handler.
fields.summary: Ability to associate a mail handler with a single project (only one handler has this feature available)

fields.description:

Link to documentation : https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-search-results-764478404.html#Workingwithsearchresults-Exportingyoursearchresults

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On certain instances, the Due Date is being displayed with one day of difference on Business project boards.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Business project.
 # Create an issue, and set the Due Date field to the current date.
 # Access the board for this project

h3. Expected Results

The Due Date should be displayed on a relative date correctly - For example, if you have set the due date for the same day you have created the issue, it should be displayed as *Today*
 !Screen Shot 2017-06-02 at 3.17.29 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Considering the same scenario mentioned above, the Due Date is displayed as *Yesterday.* The relative date on the board is considering as if you were one day behind.
 !Screen Shot 2017-06-02 at 3.16.37 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: The Due Date is not being displayed correctly on Business project boards.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In [Restricted functions in JIRA Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-applications-802592276.html], it is mentioned that it's possible to change workflow transition buttons with the help of Support.
{quote}
- Change number of workflow transition buttons
Create a support request with the number of transition buttons you want, and a 15-minute maintenance window (with 24 hours of notice) and Atlassian Support will configure it for you. (We'll be working from Advanced workflow configuration).
{quote}

h3. Suggested Resolution

With the recent changes in Cloud, this is no longer possible to be done hence we would need to remove it.
fields.summary: Update Restricted function in Cloud doc

fields.description:
h3. Summary

RSS does not show basic auth login
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on RSS icon on Activity Stream
 # Copy the link and paste on an incognito tab

h3. Expected Results

Show basic auth login prompt
h3. Actual Results

Shows blank window and do not show login prompt
h3. Notes

If the user is already logged in, it works.

Worked: JIRA v1000.892.1
Does not work: JIRA v1000.1026.0

h3. Workaround
In order to be able to see the RSS feed you can do one of the following:
# Use an RSS Feed reader that supports authentication.
# Log-into the instance before using the RSS Feed reader.
fields.summary: RSS does not show basic auth login prompt

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Cloud doesn't contain recent accepted translations of the following languages on TAC.

* Japanese
* Korean
* Portuguese

[Languages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/languages-744721667.html] lists these supported languages.


h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.1030.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as admin user
# Go to https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditApplicationProperties!default.jspa
# Change _Default language_ to Japanese
# Go to _Project settings_ of JSD project
# Check the text _"Re-index project"_ at sidebar menu is not translated
** !Screenshot_2017-06-01_15_59_55.png|thumbnail!  
# Go to [translations.atlassian.com|https://goo.gl/sBj07d]
# Check the translation of _"Re-index project"_ has been already accepted at 20 February 2017
** !Screenshot_2017-06-02_14_18_37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Texts are translated to Japanese/Korean/Portuguese if it has accepted translation at TAC

h3. Actual Results
_"Re-index project"_ is not translated.

h3. Notes
In a Manage add-ons section, we can see some languages are using Cloud Language Pack and others are not.
* Up-to-date
** JIRA Cloud French (France)
** JIRA Cloud German (Germany)
** JIRA Cloud Russian (Russia)
** JIRA Cloud Spanish (Spain)
* Out-of-date
** JIRA Core Japanese (Japan)
** JIRA Core Korean (South Korea)
** JIRA Core Portuguese (Brazil)
** JIRA Core Portuguese (Portugal)

!Screenshot 2017-06-02 14.39.22.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Some supported languages are not up-to-date

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If users exist in the JIRA database but not in User management they cannot be recreated. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create user in User management. 
# Delete from Crowd but not JIRA. 

h3. Expected Results
User would be deleted in JIRA as well during the synchronization. 
h3. Actual Results
User is not deleted causes issues if user wants to be created with the existing e-mail address used in the JIRA DB cwd_user. 

h3.Workaround
Contact support at support.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Users that exist in the JIRA database but not in Crowd prevent user from being created with the same e-mail.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In slack some channels are used only as "read-only" to see recent activity of a project. Other channels are user by teams to discuss work related to projects. These teams would benefit if they could mention a specific ticket in a channel and have jira-bot to auto-summary it.
Also would be nice to call jira-bot privately to ask for a specific issue summary.

h3. Suggested Solution
1. Enabled for mentions/queries that cross all JIRA Projects
2. Enabled for mentions/queries only for JIRA Projects to which the 
channel is configured to receive event notifications
3. Disabled entirely
fields.summary: Hability to mention an issue in private messages and different channels

fields.description:
We bundle groups of issues into new Release Versions. Each one of these issues is reviewed and receives Finance and Business Operations sign-off. The purpose of the sign-off is to have a record of validation that the business units are aware and consent to the changes we're implementing.

The problem is for most situations the business does not want to approve each issue separately as they tend to not understand each technical change listed under every issue.

It would be nice if we were able to have an approval happen on the version from a group/user instead of having it done on each ticket.
fields.summary: Version sign-off

fields.description: In JIRA Software, it would be useful to have options for "Top of Sprint" and "Bottom of Sprint" in the "Send to" section of context menu when appears when right-clicking on an issue in the Backlog view.
fields.summary: Add Top of Sprint and Bottom of Sprint to "Send to" context menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA Cloud is restarted, the ID sequence of attachments is restarted. If new attachments are created, it can cause links in the 'history' tab in an issue to link to attachments in other issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue A
# Add an attachment A to it (check ID)
# Delete the attachment A (and don't create any further attachments until step below)
# Have JIRA restarted
# Create and issue B
# Add attachments B to it (its ID will be the same as the one in issue A)
# Check history tab in issue A

h3. Expected Results
The entry for attachment in history in issue A does not generate a link for attachment A, as attachment does not exist anymore.

h3. Actual Results
Because ID is reused, it actually generates a link to attachment B (an attachment that maybe shouldn't be accessible to current user).

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Attachments sequence is reset after JIRA Restarts causing wrong links

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When two different users perform bulk operations simultaneously, JIRA will show the results of the operations erroneously.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User A starts a bulk update of a large number of issues: 1k for example.
# User B start a bulk update of a few issues: 5 for example.

h3. Expected Results
Each user will see the results of their respective bulk action.

h3. Actual Results
Both users will "Acknowledge" user's B bulk operation, as it has started later, and be redirected to User's B query on the Issue Navigator.
Additionally, it will no longer be possible to see user A bulk operation progress.
 
h3. Notes

Even though the progress will not be available via UI. User's A bulk operation will keep running on the background and will eventually be successfully completed.
fields.summary: Different users share the same Bulk Operation progress view.

fields.description:
h2.Summary

The REST endpoint /rest/api/2user?username=<username> is returning Internal Server Error on certain instances. The same REST END point can be used to create users via POST /rest/api/2/user strangely.

h3.Steps to Replicate

# Look for an ID Plat instance and create a dummy user from the user management.
# Edit the user via REST API.

h3.Current Results

{noformat}
curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "cookie: cloud.session.token=some_token"  -d '{"emailAddress": "vincent_chin@test.com","displayName": "vincent_test"}'  https://<ID-PLAT-INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?username=Atlassian+Test

{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}
{noformat}

h3.Expected Results

If the instance hasn't been migrated to Attlassian account/Identity Platform then results should be returned similar to one seen [here|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/?_ga=2.23013945.386290492.1496061640-1390794100.1489743896#api/2/user-updateUser].

If the instance is already on Attlassian account/Identity Platform then due to https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/user-management-rest-api-changes-in-jira-cloud-858756548.html PUT /rest/api/2/user may not work. However REST endpoint shouldn't return 500 Internal Server Error and documentation should notify about the changes.

h2. Workaround

In case of changing user email the user on his/her own needs to login to Atlassian account and manually change the email.
fields.summary: PUT /rest/api/2/user to update user details returning internal server error

fields.description:
I dislike the term "sprint" a lot. If the team is always in a sprint, they're doing it wrong. On a daily basis there should not be a sense of desperation, or a need to put in overtime. I know the term "sprint" comes from scrum, and I'm more familiar with James Shore's version of Agile. I don't know if scrum intends the word to be inherently anxiety provoking, but regardless of intent, in reality it usually means overtime.

So I don't want to engage with the team in terms of a sprint. If we're not already using a tool that uses this term, I want to keep it that way.

But if I could create a private sprint to manage my goals and reach deadlines without a manager overseeing anything I don't explicitly report, it would be a lot easier to overlook the term and use the tool.

So I guess I'm asking to either put an option in the settings for our team to change the word that appears on the button to, perhaps, "iteration," or allow me to create a sprint that is only visible to me.

[http://www.jamesshore.com/Blog/Scrum-XP-Practices-Cross-Reference.html]
fields.summary: I'd like to use the Board, but I have issues with "sprints" as-is

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently,  there isn't an option in current JIRA configurations to send notifications based on conditions.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to create a notification scheme based on conditions.

h3. Why this is important
 
If would be useful e.g. in cases in which you don't want to send notifications when a specific user comments on an issue.
fields.summary: Notifications based on conditions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to view only the comments of a specific user.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to create a new tab, e.g. "Comments by X", which group all the comments added by user X only, while the existing tab "Comments" have all the comments NOT ADDED by user X only

h3. Why this is important
 
It's important to make it easier to find the comments of a specific user.
fields.summary: Create "Comments by" tab in activity section

fields.summary: Errors when migrating JIRA Cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When customers answer tickets from the e-mail threads, all the previous mail content is added to the comments section.

h3. Suggestion
Add a filter to remove the previous e-mail thread when customers answer e-mails.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Remove JIRA mail trails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA and Confluence UI not loading correctly. 
h3. Environment
Affects JIRA and Confluence Cloud
h3. Errors
You will see one of the following errors
 # An error occurred connecting to the server. Please try again. 
!Screen Shot 2017-05-26 at 3.46.14 PM.png|thumbnail!
 Some Elements in JIRA / Confluence UI may not load correctly. 
 

The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
The request could not be satisfied.
CloudFront wasn't able to connect to the origin.

h3. Status update:
The incident has been identified and is being worked on to provide a solution ASAP.
Please follow latest updates at: http://status.atlassian.com/incidents/j78vvqz29wn0
fields.summary: UI not rendering correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some users aren't listed on user picker fields
h3. Environment
 * JIRA v1000.1010.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for the user on a user picker field. Example: Permission Helper

h3. Expected Results

User is listed
h3. Actual Results

The user is now shown
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Enter the user name and then hit {{Enter}}

Note: The workaround provided might not work for all instances.
fields.summary: Some users aren't listed on user picker fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking the application navigator (hamburger menu) using Internet Explorer 11 doesn't do anything.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using IE11 go to JIRA and click the application navigator

h3. Expected Results
It would open and you would be able to select the applications listed there.

h3. Actual Results
The application list doesn't show up.
 
h3.Workaround
Use Firefox, or Chrome
fields.summary: Application Navigator doesn't work on IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Due to recent changes on the Atlassian Cloud, users are being notified when there's a no verified email domain set as "Project Email Address". Details can be found on the following article: [Configuring JIRA Cloud to send emails on behalf of your domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html?subid=929463830&jobid=101783731&utm_campaign=EML-1462&utm_medium=email&utm_source=alert-email]

However, some customers may still receive notifications and that could be caused by a deleted project which had a custom Project Email Address.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Project.
# Set a custom email address for the project. 
# Delete the project.

h3. Expected Results

You'll not receive warnings about a not verified 'Project Email Address'.

h3. Actual Results

You'll still receive such warnings.

h3.Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Deleted projects with custom email domains still require verification

fields.description:
*Summary*

System Admin unable to configure  ** the landing page for users when they access their instance.

 

*Example:*

Currently when user login, they seeing JIRA page. We don't have the option to change landing page to confluence.
fields.summary: Unable to configure Application landing page

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Comment is not displayed in a screen on JIRA Cloud mobile


h2. Steps to reproduce
# Set comment field as a validator in your workflow on one of the transition


h2. Expected
Comment field is displayed in the screen


h2.  Result
No comment field in the screen.


h3. Notes
Only occurs in mobile

h3. Screenshot:

h4. In Cloud instance (Web) 
!image.png|thumbnail!

h4. In Mobile 
!mobile.jpeg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Comment field is missing in a screen on JIRA Cloud mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Version Report gadget is blank

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.996.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard
# Add Version Report

h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to change the settings and the report should be loaded

h3. Actual Results
The gadget remains blank and can't be edited
{noformat}Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 ()
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Version Report gadget not working

fields.description: Currently, when a customer selects a "due date", they are able to select tomorrow which sets unrealistic expectations.  We would like to be able to customize this (min 3 days out, min week out, etc)
fields.summary: Would like to be able to restrict date chooser

fields.description: My request is very similar to JRACLOUD-26709.  I have a team that would like to populate custom fields based on when the ticket was created, or when a project is scheduled to go live in production (example, creation date +5 or Go Live Date - 5).  This would help them track key milestones
fields.summary: Would like to be able to set a relative date in a custom date field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Newly added users are not listed in the *Add users to a role* user search

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create users in User and Management
# Add the newly added users in the *Add users to a role* in a project's Users and roles config

h3. Expected Results
The user is listed in the list of users
h3. Actual Results
The user is not listed in the list of users

h3. Notes
- The users will appear after some time but is not instantly as expected.

h3.Workaround
Searching the user using the user's full username enables searching for the user.
fields.summary: Newly added user cannot be listed in Users and Roles

fields.description:
When selecting "Invite your team" in JIRA, when there are license limitations, a generic error message is displayed: "Something's not working, try inviting people again later."

However, this is poor advice: the problem will not be resolved over time. Instead, there should be a specific message stating that a user cannot be added due to a licensing issue.
fields.summary: More helpful message when inviting team

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's impossible to search an issue by summary typing the letters BE
h3. Environment

 
|*Version*|1000.990.2|
|*Build Number*|100044|
|*Build Date*|Fri May 19 00:00:00 PDT 2017|
|*Build Revision*|9546d2018b6f5c78616b384ee4af032322b8c504|
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create one issue with BE or be anywhere inside the summary field. For example: BE - Atlassian Test.
 # Go to issues search section > advanced search > type: summary ~ be

h3. Expected Results

Should result issues that contains the text BE in some part of summary. 
h3. Actual Results

No issue comes out of the query.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround yet.
fields.summary: Cannot search JIRA issue summaries typing BE
Selected roles have dropped off from workflow transitions simultaneously across ALL workflows

The project is created, but no one can browse it.

h3. Expected Result:

Project is created and user is taken to project admin page.

h3. Workaround:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Exception+is+thrown+when+creating+projects+based+on+GreenHopper+templates
fields.summary: Creating the 'Agile Kanban' or 'Agile Scrum' project types require the active user have browse permission according to default permissions/role

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Caption "Create task" is now translated into Russian as "Создать проблему".

h3. Suggested Solution

In Russian the word "проблема" is used for some big and unsolvable thing and the correct replacement for the caption is "Создать задачу".

h3. Why this is important

The word "задача" is a significantly better translation for "issue" or "task".
fields.summary: Incorrect Russian translation

fields.description:
Users would like to view the buttons for the available transitions on quick issue view panel on the backlog.

Currently, it's only possible to view the transitions opening the issue details in a new screen or clicking on the three dots (...) and selecting "More Options".

Thank you.
fields.summary: Show transitions in Quick Issue View in Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Accessing Boards in the JIRA cloud mobile application fails with "Internal Server Error"

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Install JIRA Cloud mobile application
- Login 
- Access Boards

h3. Expected Results

Boards will be loaded on the mobile application.

h3. Actual Results

Internal Server Error banner will be shown

h3.Workaround

Use the browser of the mobile device and access JIRA cloud.
fields.summary: Board view on JIRA mobile app fails with internal server error

fields.description:
!image-2017-05-19-14-04-39-732.png!

Several times now in the past day or two I have had this disruptive advertisement appear while transitioning issues in JIRA Cloud Agile Active Sprint view. 

I'm happy for you guys to advertise your services, but please, please do not interrupt what I am doing to advertise something; it's rude, and it makes me respect the service and the people providing it less. If I have to click to get the advert away from the screen, you are one step closer to losing a customer.
fields.summary: Do not spawn interruptive advertisements on JIRA Cloud instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Service Desk does not load after migrating from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server
JIRA Cloud uses the jira.fixed.cdn.enabled dark feature to improve AWS performance. This dark feature comes along to JIRA Server when JIRA is migrated and causes JIRA Service Desk to not load successfully.
JIRA Cloud needs to disable this feature during the export to Server process.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a JIRA Cloud instance
# Restore the backup into JIRA Server
# Open the Customer Notifications page (for example) in a Service Desk project

h3. Expected Results
Page load successfully

h3. Actual Results
Page displays spinning wheel forever
Browser console displays "net::ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS" error.

h3.Workaround
As described on [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Service+Desk+is+stuck+at+loading+after+upgrade+to+version+3.3]
# Navigate to jira-url/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
# Locate jira.fixed.cdn.enabled and press Disable (this will remove it from the list of dark features)
fields.summary: Dark feature jira.fixed.cdn.enabled breaks JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the customer tries to change the Menu Item Highlight Background Color it persists in the default blue and the text persists in black.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.967.1

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Open look and feel of the JIRA Application
# Change the color of the *Menu Item Highlight Background Color* and in the *Menu Item Highlight Text Color*
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected result
The background color and text color of a selected menu item should be the ones the customer have defined.

h3. Actual result
The background color and the text color does not change and stays in the default colors.

h3. Notes
The color theme details in the "Colors" section of the "Look and feel" page are displaying with the correct custom colors, but JIRA is displaying all the default colors in the menu drop-down.

h3. Workaround
None yet.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud User unable to change the Menu Item Highlight Background Color and text color

h2. *Current Behaviour*

No option to import users. As a result, admin would not be able to bulk create users.
h2. *Requested Behaviour*

Allow site admin to import/export users via User Management page.

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Make sure your browser's size is at 90% or higher
 # Go to the Issue Search page and click on comment button on the issue.

!video.mp4!
h4. Expected results

Top Navigation menu is unchanged. Only the issue page is scrolled down, not the entire browser.

Zoomed your browser out to 80% or lower

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Cloud enviromment
# Install Tempo Timesheet on it
# Create a couple Accounts on this environment
# Generate a Backup of this Cloud instance
# Import it into a Server environment
# Install Tempo on the Server environment
# Notice that there are no Accounts imported

I'm attaching a test Cloud backup which contains Accounts as per the screen shot:

!Accounts.png|thumbnail!

Notice that no Account information is mentioned on either <entities.xml> or <activeobjects.xml>.

h3. Workaround

The procedure mentioned on[Importing and exporting accounts|https://tempoplugin.jira.com/wiki/display/TEMPO/Importing+and+exporting+accounts] will import the accounts and work logs associated.
fields.summary: Tempo Accounts field not being imported on JIRA Server import

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The default email notification setting is missing in some instances. It prevents users from changing the default jira@instancename.atlassian.net email to a custom email.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to cogwheel > *Projects* > select any project
# Click on *Notifications*
# Observe that the default email notification setting is missing:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behavior
Users should able to edit the default email notification setting:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual behavior
Default email notification setting is missing
fields.summary: Default email notification setting is missing in some instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the user configures a JIRA WebHook to fire when an Issue Updated and Worklog Changed events occur and he performs a workflow transition where he logs work directly during the transition, the Worklog Updated JSON will have information about the time logged during the transition, but the Issue Updated event won't.
h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a WebHook and set all issue related events:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Put the log work field in a JIRA screen and associate it with a workflow transition
# Perform the workflow transition and log work on it.

h3. Expected Results
The WebHook will be triggered once for the Log Work and another time for the Issue Update.
Both should have the time tracking information.

h3. Actual Results
The time tracking information will have old values for the Issue Updated WebHook.

h3.Workaround
No workaround for this scenario.
The user can still log work and then perform the transition to get accurate data.
fields.summary: JIRA WebHook for Worklog Changed and Issue Updated are not sending correct timetracking information

fields.description:
At a glance, it is not always obvious when sub-task tickets are shown with their parents in scrum columns.

The light-grey box that covers them all is too subtle and would be nice if this was visually clearer.

This would help with our stand-ups as we tend to talk about the sub-tasks and then someone asks about what that parent ticket is, not realising that it has already been covered.
fields.summary: Make sub-task relationships clearer on Scrum board

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) For CJK users | borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
Are you facing unexpected search result with CJK (Chinese/Japanese/Korean) query? Please try the following setting.

 # Login as administrator
 # Go to Settings page [https://__EXAMPLE__.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditApplicationProperties!default.jspa|https://__example__.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditApplicationProperties!default.jspa] > Change _"Indexing language"_ to proper setting such as "Chinese/Japanese/Korean" > Push _"Update"_ button
 # Wait for a while (depends on total size of issues) until index is automatically refreshed

 
日本語で利用している方は [JIRA Cloud で日本語の検索がおかしくなった|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/JIRA-discussions/JIRA-Cloud-%E3%81%A7%E6%97%A5%E6%9C%AC%E8%AA%9E%E3%81%AE%E6%A4%9C%E7%B4%A2%E3%81%8C%E3%81%8A%E3%81%8B%E3%81%97%E3%81%8F%E3%81%AA%E3%81%A3%E3%81%9F/m-p/636893#M1047] もご参照ください。

{panel}



h3. Summary

JIRA Cloud does not show any result if:
 * Search query length is 3+
 * Search query text is in multibyte chars

h3. Environment
 * JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change _"Indexing language"_ configuration to anything except English, let's say _"Chinese/Japanese/Korean"_ here
 ** !Screenshot_2017-05-16_13_29_17.png|thumbnail!
 # Create an issue whose summary satisfies following 2 conditions, such as _"おはようございます、先生"_
 ** Written in multibyte chars
 ** Length is longer than 3
 # You can find issue if query text is 2, such as {{text ~ "先生"}}
 # You cannot find any issue if query text is longer than 2, such as {{text ~ "おはようございます"}}

h3. Expected Results

Able to find the issue by {{text ~ "おはようございます"}} as well.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to find the issue by {{text ~ "おはようございます"}}.
h3. Note

Verified affected languages so far are:
 * Chinese
 * Japanese

!chinese_query_2.png|thumbnail! !chinese_query_3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 * Contact Atlassian Support [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]
fields.summary: Cannot search issue if query is longer than 2 and in multibyte chars

fields.description:
With the release of a new section for management of application links, we have noticed that the applink deletion form is displayed incorrectly.
We develop the add-on TeamCity Integration for JIRA, so this issue relates to us. Could you please correct the markup for custom applinks, as for native applinks everything works ok  !confluence applink form.png|thumbnail! /I changed the name trying to see whether number of characters causes this behavior/.
The similar issue relates and Confluence.
fields.summary: Markup of the Delete Application Link form cracks for custom applinks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Version Workload report is not appearing when tempo is set as the "Time tracking provider" in system > issue features > time tracking

Steps to Reproduce

# access cog icon > system issue features > time tracking;
# Change from "JIRA provided time tracking" to "Tempo Timesheets"
# when accessing any project reports menu, the "Version Workload Report" is not available

h3. Expected Results

The report is available for both time tracking methods


h3. Actual Results

When selected "Tempo Timesheets", "Version Workload Report" is not available in the reports of the projects


h3. Notes

NA

h3.Workaround

*none*
fields.summary: Version Workload Report not appearing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Completed backup export zip file isn't showing up in IE11. Instead, "Please wait..." is written.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud (JIRA v1000.962.0)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to JIRA Backup Manager
# Create a Backup without attachment (so that you get fast result)

h3. Expected Results
"Site Backup.zip" download link should be visible once the export has completed

h3. Actual Results
"Please wait..." is written on the screen. When checked in console, the following error can be seen: 
* !Backup manager - JIRA-000111.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
It only affects IE11. The download link can be seen if the page is opened through Google Chrome

h3.Workaround
At the moment, try opening the page through another browser such as Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox
fields.summary: JIRA Backup Manager result isn't showing up on IE11

fields.description:
It's currently not possible to export the timestamps for each of the step an issue goes through. For e.g a project named "Project A" has the following statuses :

Open
 In Progress
 Resolved
 Deployed
 Closed
h3. Suggestion

Implement the ability to report on status changes.
fields.summary: Report on status changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you attach images with the exact same name and extension, and try to display then on a comment, JIRA will show the same image or the wrong image instead of the one you attached.

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v1000.962.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a ticket
# Attach 3 different images with the same name and extension
# Try to display the 3 images in the comment of the ticket
# It will display the same image on all entries

h3. Expected Results
The images should be displayed in the right order and the right file should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
JIRA makes a confusion and mistakenly displays a wrong image with the same name
 
h3.Workaround
Change the name of all files.
fields.summary: Images with the same name are displayed wrong in the comments of a ticket

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Start Date* and *Release Date* are being saved with "day -1" while editing a release.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the project releases.
# Click to edit a release and change the *Start Date* and the *Release Date* fields.
!step1.png|thumbnail!
# Hit save.
!step2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The dates should be saved as the ones selected.

h3. Actual Results
The new dates are decreased one day.
!step3.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Select the next day of the one you want.
fields.summary: After editing the dates on a Release, the date saved is one day earlier than the date selected

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JIRA v1000.892.1 this does not occur only in JIRA (1000.962.0) new release we perceived this behavior.

When configuring a custom field with select list (cascading) type, you can delete the option nested inside a parent list, however, this action should only delete one option and after the new release, all options are been wiped from the custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a custom field using the select list (cascading) type.
# Create parent list and options in the new custom field.
# Delete one of the options within parent list.

h3. Expected Results

Only the selected option would be deleted.

h3. Actual Results

All options are deleted.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: When deleting an option inside a cascading field all other options are removed

fields.description: please add a JIRA hotkey to collapse/expand Versions + Epics, while in backlog view
fields.summary: hotkey to collapse/expand Versions + Epics

fields.description:

h3. Notes
It also happens when adding other values to the search "mylabels in (test, otherlabel, EMPTY)"
The problem does not happen when searching for "mylabels is EMPTY"
It does not happen with the default "labels" field

h3.Workaround
The filter can be accessed when it is displayed on the Favourites bar on the left.
To fix the filter do:
# Go to Manage Filter
# Search for the filter that can be viewed
# Add it to your favourites by adding a star to it
# Click on any other filter that can be viewed correctly.
# Click the name of the filter now showing on the left panel as a favourite.
# Remove the "EMPTY" search and hit Enter to search.
# Save the filter
fields.summary: 500 error viewing filter that searches for EMPTY in a Labels type field

fields.summary: FILTER CARDS BEFORE PRINTING

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, no way to move an issue in JIRA from one instance to another (linked via Application links, for example.)

h3. Suggested Solution
When linking JIRA Application to another, provide an option when moving the issue to select a project on a separate instance

h3. Why this is important
Ease of use between two instances
 
h3. Workaround 
# Create issues using [CSV Importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer]
# or [Merge the JIRA Cloud Instances|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-merge-two-jira-cloud-instances-691011863.html]
- However, this doesn't provide the ability to do it on-the-fly.
fields.summary: Ability to move issue from one JIRA instance to another
User cannot edit or delete jira issues

fields.description:
Hi,

We'd really like to be able to generate a URL (Something like [https://hindsight.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/upm?key=pro.behave.hosted]) to the UPM page that automatically expands a given plugins information.

We've implemented a getting started page and would like to direct the administrator to the UPM to enter the license key.

Thank you
fields.summary: Feature request: Auto expand a given plugins information from "Manage add-ons" page
